title: Behavior of a function based on derivative graph

content.question: The graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3983@</annotation> </semantics> </math> the derivative of the function f, is shown above. Which of the following statements must be true? I. f has a relative minimum at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39C1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. II. The graph of f has a point of inflection at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39C0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. III. The graph of f is concave down for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgY da8iaadIhacqGH8aapcaaI0aaaaa@3A73@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
